revised_title: Electrical Experiments on the Torpedo Fish
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the torpedo fish to study its electrical properties. They discovered that the fish's electricity can magnetize a needle and move it in a spiral wire and a multiplier. The fish's electricity can also pass through air and produce luminous sparks, but it does not affect the common electrometer. The author also found that the fish can act as a chemical agent, evolving gas and affecting solutions of salt and nitrate of silver.
